data.title: Z Databases
data.text:
The most frequently-used databases

Africa Commons: African history & culture This link opens in a new window

Featured

Index to over 4,000 collections from around the world providing in-depth coverage of African history and culture. Serves as a directory of archives, libraries, museums, galleries and cultural organizations within Africa.

Africa Commons: South African magazines, 1937 - 1973 This link opens in a new window

New Featured

Alternate Name(s) Black South African magazines

Digitised collection of rare, historical and out-of-copyright magazines from 1937 - 1973. of historically significant magazines written for the African audience.

Includes Drum Magazines, The Township, Grace, Hi-Note, Contrast and others.

Africa Commons: Southern African films and documentaries This link opens in a new window

Featured

Streaming access to films and documentaries of more than a century of African history, politics and culture. Includes propaganda, newsreels, documentaries, feature films and interviews. Includes material from the SA Information Service, African Mirror, interviews with writers, journalists and activists, documentary and feature films.

Lexis+ UK (new platform) This link opens in a new window

Featured

New platform from April 2024

Online legal research tool offering access to extensive UK and global legal information. It provides full text access to UK, US and international case law, legislation and articles in legal journals, plus an online version of Encyclopaedia of Forms and Precedents and Halsburyâ€™s Laws of England. Also provides access to Lexis International materials and UK Practical Guidance.

ScienceOpen: Unisa Press This link opens in a new window

Featured

Preprint and open peer review platform which allows for rapid dissemination of the latest findings in diverse topics and to promote submissions from any grade of researcher at the University of South Africa (Unisa) and beyond. Researchers at all career stages, including early career researchers, professionals, and senior scholars are invited to submit high quality research manuscripts.
